instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: Three Beep of Death
threads.message: I realize what the three beep of death means typically, have also tried resetting everything... Has anyone found other causes of this beside RAM? Anyone have any luck changing out RAM? The board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.

threads.title: Three Beep of Death
threads.message: Was this board liquid damaged, how did this happen?

threads.title: Three Beep of Death
threads.message: it was liquid damaged.  I found a number of missing power rails, and was able to repair them. It was also US cleaned.

threads.title: Three Beep of Death
threads.message: Check voltage on L7430. Also check if any of the RAM chips seem to get warmer than normal. It could also be corrosion under the CPU or RAM chips. If voltages seem ok and no chips heat up you can put some flux under the RAM and CPU and give them some heat, 150C do NOT fully reflow, just some heat.

threads.title: Three Beep of Death
threads.message: At L7430 I have 0 volts... Probed around and am having trouble figuring out where in circuit the problem lies. Voltage drop is .15... not sure if this is low.

threads.title: Three Beep of Death
threads.message: Measure voltage on pins 16 and 17 of <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> while the machine is on, and have eyes opened for burned things and corrosion.

threads.title: Three Beep of Death
threads.message: This is strange... <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> is tied into the <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> bus so that should not come high and the machine would not even beep. Are you sure you have no voltage on L7430 when the machine is beeping?

threads.title: Three Beep of Death
threads.message: well, like 140mv I did have to jumper around <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> some burnt traces but they werent a big deal, just to their respective components.
